metadata.title: CVE-2016-8734 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Apache Subversion's mod_dontdothat module and HTTP clients 1.4.0 through1.8.16, and 1.9.0 through 1.9.4 are vulnerable to a denial-of-serviceattack caused by exponential XML entity expansion. The attack can cause thetargeted process to consume an excessive amount of CPU resources or memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.1
libapache2-svn - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.1
libsvn-java - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.1
libsvn-perl - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.1
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.1
libsvn1 - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.1
python-subversion - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.1
ruby-svn - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.1
subversion - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.1
subversion-tools - 1.9.3-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: subversion package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3-2ubuntu1.1').
